description: From Middle English undergon, from Old English undergān (“to undergo, undermine, ruin”), equivalent to under- +‎ go. Cognate with Dutch ondergaan (“to undergo, perish, sink”), German untergehen (“to perish, sink, undergo”), Swedish undergå (“to undergo, go through”).

verbs.description: undergo (third-person singular simple present undergoes, present participle undergoing, simple past underwent, past participle undergone)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To go or move under or beneath.
(transitive) To experience; to pass through a phase.
examples: The project is undergoing great changes.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To suffer or endure; bear with.
examples: She had to undergo surgery because of her broken leg.
